pullRequest.body:
Under this new definition, `Algebra.FormallySmooth` is only defined for commutative rings.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11533487127/job/32106475528)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11533487127/job/32106475665)

Are you intentionally switching from semirings to rings? If so, please write a short reasoning in the PR commit message. I suppose this is because the equivalence with the old definition of formally unramified is only valid in the case of rings, right?

Yes. The differential module only makes sense when they are commutative rings.
I have no idea if the original definition makes sense for noncommutative semirings or not anyways.
The PR message is updated.

```suggestion
An `R`-algebra `A` is formally unramified if `[AR]` is trivial.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(RingTheory/Unramified): Switch official definition to allow general universes
